answer: box jumps, plyo pushups, kettlebell swings, push-presses, and squats are great movements for increasing power.

question: why do i get a headache after exercising?
answer: its not unusual to have a headache after you exercise. you might feel the pain on one side of your head or experience throbbing pain across your entire head. several things can cause this to happen. common cause are youre dehydrated, youve spent too much time in the sun, your blood sugar is low or your form is off.

question: is yoga beneficial for athletes?
answer: yoga has many mental and physical benefits that can enhance an athletes performance. it can also help relieve stress, encourage relaxation, and support healthy sleep patterns. these benefits are useful for athletes who are prone to overexertion.from increasing flexibility to building mental resilience necessary for competition, yoga offers a wealth of benefits for athletes.

question: what are some tips and strategies for starting a running routine?
answer: invest in a good pair of running shoes to reduce injuries and increase comfort. stick with lightweight pants, shorts, and shirts designed for fitness activities. create a playlist with the music most likely to keep you moving. use fitness trackers.

question: which are the mental health benefits of exercise?
answer: exercise can help to regulate stress hormones and trigger the release of mood-bosting neurotransmitters. when combined with other treatments, exercise can help with symptoms of several mental health conditions, including depression and adhd.

question: does resistance training make you gain weight?
answer: resistance training is an essential part of a comprehensive fitness program. whether your goals are to improve weight or body composition, increase strength and function, or improve overall health, resistance training can help you get there. if you are new to resistance training, start slowly with lower resistance and gradually progress over time.

question: how to get back to fitness after an injury?
answer: coming back from an injury can be challenging and frustrating, but dont let it get the best of you. take your time, stay consistent with your workouts and recognize when you need help.

question: what are the 5 components of fitness?
answer: the five components of fitness include cardio endurance, muscular strength, muscular endurance, flexibility, and body composition. cardio endurance is your ability to perform an aerobic exercise, such as walking or running, for a certain length of time. muscular endurance is how well you can sustain that movement before becoming fatigued. flexibility refers to your able to move your joints through a range of motion. body composition describes the ratio of fat and muscle in your physique.

question: what is aerobic exercise?
answer: aerobic exercise is also called cardio or cardiovascular training, and involves rhythmic movement that forces your heart to pump faster. aerobic exercises can be either low-intensity or high-intensity. some examples include walking, running, dancing, swimming, or cycling. the word aerobic means with oxygen, referring to how your body uses oxygen during exercise.

question: what are core exercises?
answer: core exercises are an important part of strength training that builds muscles in your pelvis, abdomen, and spine. building a strong core helps you to maintain good posture, boosts your mobility and endurance, alleviates lower back pain, and helps you avoid falls and injury as you get older. some examples of core exercises include reverse crunches, planks, bridges, and prone arm and leg raises.

question: what is nordic walking?
answer: nordic walking involves walking with two lightweight poles that resemble ski poles. as you walk, you push the poles against the ground, maintaining a relaxed grip and using the straps to press down on the back swing. the more pressure you apply, the more your upper-body muscles will be engaged.

question: what intensity level is associated with indoor cycling?
answer: indoor cycling is considered very high intensity. it involves sustained elevated heart rates for 45-60 minutes with brief moments of slower pedaling.

question: what are the benefits of indoor cycling?
answer: indoor cycling offers several benefits, including shedding fat, improving heart health, boosting muscle endurance, and providing a serious workout for the legs.

question: how do i choose the right routine for my goals?
answer: the choice of a workout routine is one of the most heavily debated topics, bar none, especially among those who are just getting started.effort and consistency over time in training and eating in accordance with your goals are, by miles, more important than what specific routine you choose. different individuals can respond better to different methods of training.

question: what type of exercise is indoor cycling?
answer: indoor cycling is primarily an aerobic exercise, as it keeps the heart rate elevated throughout the workout. it also provides a strength component, as it helps to boost muscle strength and endurance.

question: what are some stress relieving exercises?
answer: aerobic, resistance training, mixed-mode and mind-body exercises can improve psychological distress, anxiety and depression in adults.

question: can i lose fat and build muscle at the same time?
answer: the ability to gain muscle while losing fat is dependent on the relationship between your fatness and muscularity. an overly-fat and under-trained person will be able to achieve simultaneous fat loss and muscle gain. a very lean person near his/her limit for muscle growth will not.

question: is indoor cycling low-impact?
answer: yes, indoor cycling is considered low-impact, as there is no pounding involved. It is gentle on the hip, knee, and ankle joints.

question: what are jumping jacks?
answer: jumping jacks are a full-body exercise involving resistance and aerobic training.

question: what are the benefits of doing jamping jacks?
answer: they target major muscle groups, increase body temperature, and improve blood flow. benefits include fat burning, muscle building, flexibility enhancement, and increased bone density.

question: how do you perform jumping jacks?
answer: to perform jumping jacks correctly, start in a standing position with feet together and arms at your sides. jump feet out to the sides while swinging arms overhead, then return to the starting position. repeat for multiple reps, maintaining proper posture and form throughout.

question: what are some myths about physical activity?
answer: some myths about physical activity are: exercise takes too much time, long work outs are better, the more you sweet the better, you have to go to gym to exercise.

question: what are some facts about walking?
answer: some facts about walking are: walking helps with blood sugar control, you must walk faster to burn more calories, silent walking is good for you.

question: what are the benefits of cross-training?
answer: implementing cross-training in your strength and conditioning regimen may offer several benefits, including improved cardio endurance, training unused muscle groups, allowing recovery time, beating boredom, and reducing the risk of injury.

question: what are some common mistakes to avoid when doing jumping jacks?
answer: common mistakes to avoid include skipping warm-up, choosing uneven surfaces, wearing unsupportive footwear, performing repetitions too quickly, and ignoring pain signals. proper form and technique are essential to prevent injuries and maximize results.

question: what is a barbell row?
answer: a barbell row is an upper-body weightlifting exercise that targets the back and shoulders.

question: what are some good biceps exercises?
answer: some good biceps exercises are cable curl, barbel curl, ez curl, chin up, incline curl and preacher curl.

question: what are some myths about walking?
answer: some myths about walking are: indoor and outdoor steps yield the same results, you have to walk 30 minutes continuously to see health benefits, you shouldn’t walk every day of the week, walking can cure depression and anxiety.

question: what is periodization training?
answer: periodization training is the deliberate manipulation of training variables to optimize performance for competition, prevent overtraining, and progress performance.

question: is there a cheat code to get six-pack abs faster?
answer: you may be able to get six-pack abs faster by reducing calories, increasing protein, and doing high intensity and resistance training.

question: how to perform a barbell row?
answer: to perform a barbell row, stand with feet shoulder-width apart, squat down to grab the bar with hands wider than shoulder-width, brace your torso, lift the bar using hips and knees, then bend forward at the waist, keeping your back flat and chest up. pull the barbell towards your chest, then lower it back down with control.

question: what exercises can i do to lose fat in my body part?
answer: you cannot target where you lose fat. this is commonly called spot reduction and it is a myth. your genes are responsible for where your body stores fat and where it comes from when losing weight in a first on, last off manner. so if the first place you get fat is your belly, its probably going to be the last place to lose it.

question: what are some simple plyometric exercises?
answer: simple plyometric exercises include side jumps, jump rope and forward hopes.

question: which muscles does the barbell row work?
answer: the barbell row primarily targets muscles such as the rhomboids, lats, middle and lower traps, and posterior deltoid, while also engaging synergist muscles like the biceps, teres minor, brachialis, brachioradialis, and erector spinae.

question: should i lift weights if i am trying to lose weight?
answer: yes. lifting helps spare muscle while eating a deficit. this has the two-fold advantage of reducing body fat faster and giving you a stronger starting point once you start bulking. there are also numerous benefits to strength training and the sooner you get started, the sooner you will start to realize them.

question: did i hurt myself or is this normal soreness?
answer: always seek the advice of a doctor or other medical professional with any concerns you may have regarding a potential injury.

question: am i not getting a good workout if im not sweating?
answer: how much you sweat is determined by your genetics and is influenced by several factors including age, gender, weight, fitness level, medications and environmental conditions.

question: i stopped lifting for a time, how do i start?
answer: if you are coming back to it after a long time, be prepared for your lifts to have gone down probably by a lot. if your break was short, you can likely just pick up where you last left it.

question: how do i do a new lift? do i need to learn from a trainer?
answer: many people learn good form/mechanics from watching videos, and only use a trainer when they run into a real stumbling block. the advice is to still record yourself doing a lift and seeing where you go wrong.

question: should i train full-body or a body-part split?
answer: beginners to weight training are defined by how quickly they can recover from exercise. strength gains in beginners are optimized by training three times a week. as one gains more experience and ability, a two-day split is suggested as the optimal set-up.

question: what are the benefits of performing barbell rows?
answer: barbell rows help build muscle strength in the back and shoulders, improve trunk strength and spine stability, and enhance hip hinge movements. additionally, they can contribute to overall athletic performance and daily functional movements.

question: what are the different repetition ranges good for?
answer: research shows that almost every rep range stimulates the same amount of muscle growth so long as effort per set is the same between sets. heavier loads stimulate more bone and connective tissue growth, and lighter loads have less risk of injury. the main thing is to lift in a way that you enjoy and that encourages you to put forth high effort.

question: should i always lift to failure?
answer: it is important for beginners to focus on learning how to perform compound movements correctly. lifting to failure typically results in form breakdown that would interfere with this.

question: does cardio impair muscle gains?
answer: cardio before resistance training had no apparent negative effect on hypertrophy, though it did negatively impact leg strength. adding cardio, just like any other extra exercise, will use more calories and require that you eat more food to maintain the calorie surplus necessary to build muscle.

question: if i do cardio and resistance training, what should i do first?
answer: for general health and fitness purposes, the order does not matter. the modality you choose to do first will leave you fatigued and thus impair performance while doing the second. if you have no training preference and/or enjoy both equally, its generally recommended to do your lifting first.

question: what are some tips for maintaining good form during barbell rows?
answer: practice the motion without weights first, then start with unloaded bars or light weights to ensure proper form. focus on keeping elbows aimed towards the back, and maintain a straight and flat spine throughout the exercise. avoid flaring elbows outward or rolling the upper back and shoulders forward.

question: what is an incline bench press?
answer: an incline bench press is a variation of the bench press that targets the upper part of the pectoral muscles. it involves lying on an inclined bench rather than a flat one, which changes the angle of the movement and shifts the emphasis to the upper chest and shoulder muscles.

question: how is an incline bench press performed?
answer: to perform an incline bench press, lie flat on an inclined bench with your feet flat on the floor. grasp the barbell at a shoulder-width grip and lift it off the rack. lower the barbell to your upper chest by bending your elbows, then push it back up to the starting position, keeping your elbows under the bar at all times. remember to maintain proper form and breathe in as you lower the bar and exhale as you push it up.

question: what are some exercises for strengthening the lats?
answer: some of the best exercises for strengthening the lats include lat pulldowns, pull-ups, and rows. these exercises engage the lat muscles effectively and can be performed using different equipment and variations to suit individual needs and preferences.

question: what are some common mistakes to avoid when performing an incline bench press?
answer: some common mistakes to avoid during an incline bench press include failing to secure the weights properly, unequal distribution of weight on the barbell, inadequate foot placement, and allowing the wrists to roll back. it's also important to start with a manageable weight and always have a spotter for safety.

question: how can i perform a lat pulldown?
answer: you can perform a lat pulldown with proper form by sitting on the pulldown machine bench, grabbing the bar overhand with hands shoulder-width apart, leaning back slightly, and pulling the bar down to the chest while engaging the elbows and squeezing the shoulder blades together. it's essential to start with light weights, focus on form, and avoid yanking the bar down or releasing it too quickly.

question: i want to lift weights but not get huge. what should i do?
answer: it is not possible to become huge and muscular by accident. unless you are specifically training and eating to be huge for a very long time, you are not going to reach that point. if you find yourself starting to get bigger than you'd like, you can always stop adding weight or volume to prevent more gains.

question: will lifting weights make me inflexible? i dont want to get muscle bound.
answer: strength training does not inherently create inflexibility when done properly. only an imbalanced program and lifting through incomplete ranges of motion can end in inflexible. top weight lifters, gymnasts, bodybuilders, and others regularly demonstrate advanced levels of flexibility while being exceedingly strong.

question: can i skip leg day?
answer: if you injured something in your lower body or you have an explicit restriction from your doctor then yes. any other reason,no. skipping strength training for the largest group of muscles in your body is not a good idea, and endurance based exercises are not an adequate substitute for resistance training.

question: should i workout again if im still sore?
answer: yes. soreness is merely a sign that your body isn't used to what you did. this is fine. you should workout again today, and make sure to properly warm up. you'll probably feel less sore after working out due to the repeated bout effect, and notice that soreness decreases in intensity as you continue working out consistently.

question: im not sore after my workout. did i do something wrong?
answer: soreness is only a sign that your body did something new. as your body adapts to new demands, soreness will lessen and maybe even go away completely.

question: how do i fix my uneven or lagging bodypart?
answer: for most, the solution is simply to continue working out using compound lifts with proper form to get stronger and things will even out with time. depending on how long your progress has been stalled, you may need to re-evaluate your routine and add more total volume.

question: how many calories did i burn?
answer: unfortunately, any answer to this question can only be an estimate at best, and it is not wise to trust any number to be 100% accurate. in particular, you should absolutely not rely on exercise machines themselves (such as treadmills) or wearable fitness gadgets to give you correct information about calorie burn.however, there are a few reference lists that can be used as a rough general estimate.

question: should i got to gym if im sick?
answer: missing one workout because you are not feeling well is not the end of the world. if it is a mild head cold you should be good to workout, but be sure to wipe down the equipment when you are done. with a chest cold its probably a good time for a rest day or two. if you are sick, cant get to the gym, and still feel the need to workout try some light bodyweight work at home. keep in mind, you should lower the intensity of your workout to prevent injury, as your body overall is in a weaker state.

question: i had a bad workout today. what happened?
answer: bad days happen to everybody, from absolute beginners to the most elite athletes. the best thing to do is just not worry about it, stick to your routine, and get back to your next scheduled workout like it didnt happen. if you are consistently over a period of weeks or more having problems, thats the time to start looking for a problem.

question: im having trouble with my grip while doing deadlifts. what can i do?
answer: directly strengthening your grip is also a good solution. remember the deadlift is not a grip exercise. you should never let your grip strength determine how much weight you train your deadlift with. the strongest men and women in the world use straps for their max deadlifts theres no shame in it at all.

question: does lifting weights stunt growth?
answer: no. lifting weights with proper form while maintaining a healthy diet will not stunt your growth. in fact, weight lifting has many benefits for youths including increased strength for sports and higher self-esteem.

question: how much strength training do i need?
answer: a beginner's strength-building workout takes as little as 20 minutes, and you won't need to grunt, strain, or sweat. the key is developing a well-rounded program, performing the exercises with good form, and being consistent. you will experience noticeable gains in strength within 4 to 8 weeks.

question: i feel self-conscious about going to the gym. what do i do?
answer: everybody was a beginner once. everyone you see in the gym who is much more strong than you had to start somewhere, just like you are now. if it seems like anyone is staring at or watching you, just assume its out of encouragement instead of judgement.

question: how to do a lat pulldown?
answer: to perform a lat pulldown correctly, begin by sitting on the pulldown machine bench, feet flat on the floor, and knees snug under the kneepad. grasp the bar overhand with hands shoulder-width apart, then lean back slightly while keeping a neutral spine supported by abdominal muscles. inhale as you pull the bar down to the chest by engaging your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together. Exhale as you return to the starting position, slowly extending your elbows and opening your shoulder blades away from the spine.

question: can exercise help with depression or generally improve my mood?
answer: exercise is one of the best things for depression. if you're sad when you have no reason to be, for an extended period of time, please see a professional. medication can help get your levels to the point where you can continue to work on your depression through exercise, therapy, diet and hobbies.

question: how to do a pull-up?
answer: start by gripping the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hanging with arms fully extended. pull yourself up by engaging your back muscles and squeezing your shoulder blades together until your chin reaches the bar, then lower yourself back down with controlled movements.

question: what muscles do tricep dips work?
answer: this exercise primarily targets the triceps but also engages the trapezius, shoulder muscles, pectorals, and abdominal muscles.

question: how to do a row?
answer: for rows, whether using a machine or resistance bands, sit with knees slightly bent and feet flat. grab the handle and pull it towards your abdomen, focusing on engaging your shoulder blades. Pause briefly, then slowly return to the starting position. variations include inverted rows, bent-over rows, and single-arm cable rows.

question: how do i perform tricep dips?
answer: tricep dips are a fundamental exercise targeting the triceps, along with engaging other key muscles. to perform tricep dips correctly, start by sitting on the ground with knees bent and feet flat, arms placed behind you on the floor with fingers facing forward. lift hips off the ground, lowering the body by bending elbows, then press down to straighten arms and raise hips back up.

question: what to do for better core strength?
what exercises are best for bone health?
answer: weight bearing activities that stimulate bone formation by putting pressure on your bones.

question: can exercise boost my gut health?
answer: exercising causes important changes that help gut microbes to bloom and convert, and coinciding with that, you get molecules your bodies can utilize.

question: how do i fix my poor posture?
answer: strength training is going to help posture more than anything else. be realistic with yourself. youre not going to undo a lifetime of poor posture and movement by only addressing specific problems once a week for 15 minutes. its take dedicated effort and vigilance to correct the root cause.

question: should i bulk or cut?
answer: the decision to bulk or cut is often a very difficult one for trainees to make. advice assumes that whatever your current body composition is, you are not happy with it and want to change. the option that will almost always give you the best results in your training and your aesthetics up front is going to be to focus on trying to gain muscle.

question: what are some types of fitness?
answer: some types of fitness are body composition, flexibility, muscular strength, muscular endurance, and cardiorespiratory endurance.

question: what are the benefits of incorporating tricep dips into a workout routine?
answer: tricep dips offer numerous benefits, including convenience as they can be performed almost anywhere. they enhance strength for other pushing movements like push-ups and muscle-ups and can improve daily activities requiring pushing motions. the exercise is adaptable to individual abilities and can contribute to muscle growth in the chest and arms.

question: what is circuit training?
answer: circuit training is a form of body conditioning that involves endurance training, resistance training, high intensity aerobics, and exercises performed in a circuit, similar to high-intensity interval training. it targets strength building and muscular endurance.

question: can exercise improve brain function?
answer: yes. as blood pumps to the brain during physical activity, it can help you think more clearly, leaving you feeling more focused after a workout. exercise also increases the size of the hippocampus – the part of the brain responsible for memory – as well as the connections between nerve in the brain, helping guard against brain injury and disease.

question: what does being physically fit mean?
answer: in general, fitness means different things to different people. the important message is that embarking on any regular exercise will be of benefit to a persons health. the more exercise they do, the healthier they will look and feel.

question: what are the mental and physical health benefits of exercise?
answer: regular exercise can reduce the risk of many serious diseases, improve mental health and mood, and extend lifespan. exercise benefits everyone. some benefits arise with very small increases in physical activity for people who are currently inactive. even if a person is far from meeting the recommended weekly activity levels, those first small steps are important and worthwhile.

question: what are the best exercises for overall health and fitness?
answer: regular exercise is important for overall health and fitness. a combination of resistance and cardiovascular training is a powerful tool to help prevent many health conditions.people can start slowly and increase the frequency of workouts or the number of repetitions and sets in each one as their fitness levels improve.

question: do i need to go to gym to be fit?
answer: fitness does not require a gym or even any special skill. a person can do plenty of simple things in or around the home to get some exercise. a daily commitment to movement, stretching, and any physical activity that feels physically and mentally good can help people stay active and fit even if quarantine lasts for several months.

question: what to know about cardiorespiratory endurance?
answer: cardiorespiratory endurance is a measure of how well the heart, lungs, and muscles perform during moderate to high-intensity physical activity. getting regular physical activity, especially aerobic exercise, can improve cardiorespiratory endurance. aerobic exercises can help promote heart and lung health and improve how well the body circulates and utilizes oxygen.

question: is exercising muscles important?
answer: yes. medical professionals recommend exercise for developing muscle strength. maintaining strength in the muscles is important for various factors, including balance, flexibility, and bone health.

question: what is the difference between aerobic and anaerobic exercise?
answer: aerobic exercises are endurance-type exercises that increase a persons heart and breathing rate over a sustained period. anaerobic exercises involve short, intense bursts of physical activity. both types of exercise are beneficial for a persons cardiovascular health. they also provide mental health benefits.

question: what is functional training?
answer: functional training involves exercises that replicate movements you perform in daily life, focusing on engaging multiple muscle groups simultaneously.

question: how is functional training different from traditional strength training?
answer: unlike traditional strength training, which often isolates specific muscle groups, functional training emphasizes movements that involve large muscle groups working together.

question: what are some examples of functional exercises?
answer: common functional exercises include push-ups, walking lunges, jump squats, balancing movements, and activities that require coordination and agility.

question: what is endurance training?
answer: also called aerobic exercise, endurance exercise includes activities that increase your breathing and heart rate such as walking, jogging, swimming, biking and jumping rope. endurance activity keeps your heart, lungs and circulatory system healthy and improves your overall fitness.

question: what are the benefits of high intensity interval training?
answer: hiit involves interspersing short bursts of intense exercise with rest periods. sessions can be as short as 15-30 minutes but provide equal or superior benefits in comparison with longer periods of moderate intensity exercise. hiit workouts may help improve cardiovascular and metabolic health, decrease body fat, and improve mental health.

question: what are the benefits of swimming?
answer: swimming burns calories and can help people manage their weight, tone their muscles, and improve their overall health and fitness.this activity engages several different muscle groups and the cardiovascular system, and it can provide an excellent workout for a wide variety of individuals. swimming may help some people elevate their mood, relax, and reduce their stress levels.

question: should i walk or run?
answer: walking and running can help people maintain a moderate weight and improve their heart health, mental health, and more. for those starting a fitness journey, walking might be a more suitable choice since it involves low or moderate intensity. for people whose goal is to burn more calories, running may be more appropriate.

question: how does yoga work?
answer: yoga is an ancient practice that has changed over time. modern yoga focuses on poses designed to stimulate inner peace and physical energy. ancient yoga did not place as much emphasis on fitness. instead, it revolved around cultivating mental focus and expanding spiritual energy.

question: what are the health benefits of tai chi?
answer: tai chi is a low-impact, noncompetitive martial art that is known for its potential health benefits. some studies show tai chi can improve brain function, lower stress and depression, and reduce chronic pain. scientists must conduct further studies to confirm its benefits.

question: what's the best way to train to improve muscular endurance?
answer: muscular endurance is a muscles ability to continue contracting against resistance over a period of time. people can improve their muscular endurance with strength and cardiovascular training.

question: what are some chest exercises?
answer: chest punches, chest press, wood chop, kneeling push ups, squat and overhead toss.

question: how to strengthen my knee?
answer: exercise is a noninvasive and healthful way to help with minor knee pain due to overuse, arthritis, or other causes.knee-strengthening exercises are an effective way to help prevent injury and keep the legs strong. stretching can also help keep the muscles flexible, which can prevent or alleviate pain.people with health conditions should speak with a healthcare professional before beginning any exercise program.

question: should i lift weights or do cardio to burn calories?
answer: both cardio and weightlifting exercises have advantages and disadvantages, and their benefits and effects vary among individuals.evidence shows that lifting weights burns more fat and has more promising long-term results. however, the type of exercise that is better for a person ultimately depends on that persons goals, physical fitness, and capabilities.most experts recommend a combination of the two for overall health and fitness.

question: what are the best exercises for weight loss?
answer: there are no single best exercises for weight loss, but some have advantages that might appeal to certain people. for example, running and walking are generally free and easy to start.exercise is an important part of weight loss. however, other factors, such as diet and sleep, also play a role.

question: what are some exercises for lower back pain?
answer: squat walks, single leg supine bridge, side lying clamshells, supermans, plank

question: is bmi useful?
answer: bmi is a useful tool that gives a general idea about whether or not a persons weight is healthy for them. it is a simple tool that does not tell the whole story about peoples individual weight and health risks. anyone who is concerned about their weight should speak with a doctor, who may also consider their body fat distribution.

question: how soon can i run after eating?
answer: eating a large meal right before a run can lead to cramping and digestive problems. it can also make you feel sluggish during your run. it’s recommended that you wait 3 to 4 hours after a large meal before running.

question: how can i lose weight?
answer: if a person wants to lose weight, there are many factors to consider, such as age, sex, diet, activity level, and health conditions. reducing calories, getting regular physical activity, eating a nutrient-dense and balanced diet, and getting quality sleep can help people lose weight.

question: how to avoid cramps while running?
answer: to prevent cramps, drink water or a sports beverage every 15 to 30 minutes while running, avoiding high fiber foods the night before and the morning of a run

question: what is low heart rate training when i exercise?
answer: low intensity heart exercising can help improve your endurance, though it may take longer to achieve your fitness goals than traditional high heart rate training.

question: how fast do i lose cardiovascular fitness?
answer: this type of fitness won’t disappear in a matter of days, but it will decrease over time. generally, cardiovascular fitness starts to noticeably decrease after about two weeks of being sedentary.

question: how can functional training benefit daily life activities?
answer: by training movements relevant to daily tasks, such as standing up from a chair or lifting objects, functional training can improve overall physical function and make everyday activities easier to perform.

question: are dance workouts good?
can exercise be a depression treatment?
answer: there is some evidence to suggest that exercise improves depression and depression symptoms, including in people with major depressive disorder. this is not always the case, however, and more research needs to confirm the effect that exercise may have. anyone looking to add exercise to their depression treatment plan should talk to their doctor first.

question: what to do if i want a better posture?
answer: incorportae stretching exercises in your routine!

question: how to strengthen the lower back?
answer: together, lower back strengthening and stretching exercises can help improve the strength, stability, and flexibility of the lower back. in doing so, they may help alleviate and prevent lower back pain.if any of the back exercises above make back pain worse, it is vital to stop doing them immediately and contact a doctor.

question: what are some exercises for easing and preventing upper back pain?
answer: before stretching, it is important to warm up. this helps prevent injury to the muscles and connective tissues. a warm-up routine should last around 6 minutes and incorporate various exercises. these include marching on the spot, knee lifts, and shoulder rolls.

question: what are the benefits of functional training?
answer: functional training helps maintain and enhance balance and coordination by promoting smooth, coordinated movements that involve multiple muscle groups.

question: what are good snacks to eat during a run?
answer: you’ll generally only need water or a sports drink during your workout for runs under 1 hour. for runs longer than an hour or very intense exercise, you’ll need to take in a form of carbohydrates, such as a sports drink or energy gel, for every hour you’re running for longer than 75 minutes.

question: does functional training contribute to injury prevention?
answer: by teaching proper movement patterns and strengthening muscles used in daily activities, functional training reduces the risk of injuries related to lifting, bending, and other common movements.

question: how does running benefit mental health?
answer: running releases endorphins and serotonin, chemicals that can improve mood. regular running can reduce stress, lessen feelings of anxiety and depression, and promote better sleep, all contributing to improved mental health.

question: how does running reduce stress?
answer: after a run, endocannabinoids are released, providing short-term feelings of reduced stress and calm. this biochemical response can help individuals better manage stressful situations both physically and mentally.

question: what physical health benefits does running offer?
answer: running improves heart health, builds muscle, and enhances brain function. just 50 minutes of running each week at a moderate pace can lower the risk of heart disease while also promoting overall physical fitness.

question: how can i establish and maintain a running routine?
answer: to establish a running routine, start small and set achievable goals. consistency is key, and having an exercise buddy can help maintain accountability. it's important to be patient, listen to your body, and gradually increase intensity over time.

question: what to know about muscle soreness?
answer: physical activity can sometimes lead to doms. the symptoms of doms usually appear several hours after physical activity and may last up to 72 hours. while doms can be uncomfortable, it does not require medical attention. people sometimes recommend home remedies to alleviate the symptoms. there is little scientific evidence to support this.

question: what to know about active recovery?
answer: active recovery can help reduce soreness and tightness after a workout. it might also improve a persons performance in the long run. however, if a person has an injury or partakes in workouts involving short, repeated bursts of high intensity exercise, passive recovery might be more beneficial.

question: what precautions should be taken when starting a running routine?
answer: before starting a running routine, it's advisable to consult with a doctor, especially if you haven't exercised in a while or have health concerns. additionally, warming up properly, setting smart goals, and allowing adequate rest between runs are essential for injury prevention and overall well-being.

question: what to know about headaches after exercise?
answer: losing fluids while exercising is an easy way to become dehydrated, which can lead to headaches. stretching properly before and after exercising may help prevent this. headaches after exercising are due to an underlying condition. those who experience exercise-induced headaches for no apparent reason or have a cardiovascular condition or other symptoms should see their doctor.

question: how effective is exercise in treating knee pain?
answer: exercise is considered the best treatment for arthritic knee pain and can also alleviate other types of knee discomfort. however, it's essential to avoid exercising if you've experienced a knee pop or if your knee exhibits signs like swelling, buckling, or locking up, which may indicate a need for medical attention.

question: what are some low-impact exercises recommended for relieving knee pain?
answer: stretching, swimming, water aerobics, using an exercise bike, and elliptical trainer are all beneficial for knee pain relief. additionally, therapeutic exercises like clamshells, straight-leg lifts, sit/stands, step-ups, and glute bridges can be effective for strengthening and supporting the knees.

question: how can i ensure the safety and effectiveness of knee exercises?
answer: starting with a low number of repetitions and gradually increasing intensity is crucial for safety and effectiveness. if any exercise causes pain, it's essential to stop immediately. additionally, gentle stretching post-exercise helps maintain muscle flexibility and prevent injury.

question: what is calisthenics?
answer: calisthenics is a type of physical exercise that utilizes body weight rather than equipment for resistance. it involves repetitive movements that engage most or all of the body, such as jumping jacks, push-ups, and lunges. unlike exercises with external weights, calisthenics relies solely on the individual's body weight.

question: what are some examples of calisthenic exercises?
answer: examples of calisthenic exercises include jumping jacks, trunk twists, push-ups, pull-ups, chin-ups, sit-ups, planks, and lunges. these exercises are typically performed for at least 10-12 repetitions, with variations available for different fitness levels.

question: what are the benefits of calisthenics?
answer: calisthenics can improve cardiovascular health by maintaining an elevated heart rate throughout the workout. performing exercises quickly without prolonged breaks between sets challenges the cardiovascular system, making calisthenics an effective cardiovascular workout.

question: how many calories can one burn through calisthenics?
answer: the number of calories burned during calisthenics depends on various factors, including intensity, effort, body weight, and age. on average, calisthenics can burn approximately 135-355 calories in 30 minutes, with higher intensity exercises resulting in greater calorie expenditure.

question: what are the benefits of barre exercises?
answer: barre classes help developing a lean muscle tone of a ballerina. benefits include improved strength, posture, flexibility balance, stability, endurance, and muscle definition, together with weight loss and reduced stress. the exercises target muscles that support and stabilise the body and which are often neglected in everyday life and by other forms of exercise.

question: what are some shoulder exercises for muscle activation?
answer: some popular shoulder exercises include the dumbbell shoulder press, push-up, cable diagonal raise, dips, dumbbell front raise, battling ropes, barbell upright row, bent-arm lateral raise, 45-degree incline row, and seated rear lateral raise.

question: which exercise burns the most calories?
answer: to get the most out of an exercise routine, a person must find something that they like doing and that they can sustain for 20-30 minutes over many weeks and months. a doctor can help with selecting a safe routine, and a physical therapist or personal trainer may be able to recommend specific exercises.

question: what is the ideal heart rate when running?
answer: the ideal running heart rate varies depending on a persons age, current fitness level, and other factors. a persons heart rate during exercise should be between 50 and 85 of their maximum heart rate. tracking heart rate while running may be especially useful for endurance training and training in different weather conditions.

question: how often to work out for weight loss and muscle gain?
answer: people cannot just work out for a set number of hours each week and expect to lose weight or gain muscle. to lose weight, a persons body should use up more calories than it takes in. studies suggest that muscle-strengthening exercise programs may take 6 to 10 weeks of work before results begin to show.

question: what are kegel exercises?
answer: kegel exercise, also known as pelvic floor exercise, involves repeatedly contracting and relaxing the muscles that form part of the pelvic floor. the exercise can be performed many times a day, for several minutes at a time but takes one to three months to begin to have an effect.

question: how to lose butt fat?
answer: with regular exercise that includes aerobic activity and targeted toning exercises, losing butt fat is an achievable goal. if these methods do not work, even with exercise and a healthful diet, a person may want to consider seeing their doctor. there may be an underlying reason for this, such as a thyroid disorder. it may also be helpful to work with a dietician or personal trainer.

question: why are the core muscles important?
answer: the core muscles help protect the spine, stabilize the body, improve posture and balance, and increase strength. working these muscles through resistance-based exercise can help improve mobility.

question: is plyometric training a good workout?
answer: plyometrics are effective for improving power, speed, and agility. theyre helpful for specific sports or performance goals, like jumping higher, sprinting faster, or changing direction more quickly and efficiently. those who implement plyos may see improvements within weeks.

question: is plyometric training good for beginners?
answer: there are ways to safely add plyometric training into any workout routine, even for beginners. however, plyometric exercises are more advanced and require a good understanding of fundamental bodyweight exercises like squats, lunges, and pushups. master proper technique for basic exercises before trying plyometrics to prevent injury.

question: can plyometrics help with weight loss?
answer: when added to a general fitness and nutrition program, plyometrics can play a role in weight loss. that said, plyometrics alone are unlikely to be the most efficient weight loss approach. plyometric workouts are short and may not offer the same calorie burn as other strength and cardio activities.

question: what equipment do i need for plyometric training?
answer: you dont need any equipment to perform plyometric exercises many can be performed using body weight alone. however, gear allows you to do more exercises. consider tools like a jump rope, stable box (also known as a plyo box), medicine ball (a weighted ball), and small hurdles.

question: can i do plyometrics every day?
answer: plyometric exercises are tough on the joints due to their all-out, explosive nature. plyometric exercises should only be performed two to three times a week, allowing 48 to 72 hours of rest between sessions.

question: how much walking should i do in a day?
answer: walking is moderate-intensity exercise getting 30 minutes at least five times weekly is a baseline for seeing health benefits. walking more than that is linked to even more health benefits.

question: how does walking benefit my health?
answer: walking can help you live a longer life. walking at a moderate pace can help lower your risk of heart disease, lower your risk for high cholesterol, high blood pressure, and diabetes, and improve chronic back pain and mental health.

question: is walking better than running?
answer: walking and running share some of the same health benefits although for walking it takes longer, depending on your pace. studies have found that a brisk walk can lower your risk of high cholesterol, high blood pressure, and diabetes just as much as running does.

question: can i lose weight just by walking?
answer: walking is a great way to burn calories and help with weight loss goals. walking, just like other types of exercise, can create the calorie deficits you need to lose weight. this number varies from person to person.

question: how long do i have to walk for a good workout?
answer: this depends on the terrain, your pace, and your fitness level. increase the intensity of your walks by walking hills, picking tougher terrain (like an uneven surface of sand), and doing intervals where you alternate picking up the pace and slowing down. picking up the pace means you can reap the same health benefits in less time.

question: what do kegels do?
answer: kegels strengthen the muscles that make up the pelvic floor. in women, kegel exercises may help with childbirth.

question: how do you properly do kegels?
answer: alternating between tightening and relaxing them for 10 seconds. do three sets of 10 to 15 repetitions daily.

question: what happens if you do kegels every day?
answer: its recommended to do kegels every day. consistent exercise can strengthen your pelvic floor muscles.

question: what happens if you dont do kegels?
answer: if you dont perform exercises to strengthen your pelvic floor, these muscles can weaken with age, pregnancy, childbirth, or surgery. keep in mind that kegels arent beneficial for everyone. its best to check with your doctor before doing kegels.

question: can you overdo kegels?
answer: as with any muscle group, its possible to overexercise the pelvic floor muscles. doing too many kegels or doing kegels when you dont need to can make the muscles too tense or tight.

question: what is liss cardio?
answer: liss cardio stands for low intensity steady-state cardio. it involves slower aerobic activities like walking, jogging, or cycling at a comfortable pace for an extended period of time.

question: how do liss workouts differ from high-intensity interval training?
answer: liss training focuses on keeping the heart rate consistent and slightly elevated for longer periods of time, while hiit involves raising the heart rate much higher for shorter bursts of time.

question: what are the health benefits of liss training?
answer: liss training can help lower the risk of high blood pressure, stroke, obesity, diabetes, and certain types of cancer. it also improves muscle strength, aerobic fitness, mental health, cognitive function, and sleep.

question: can liss workouts help with weight loss?
answer: liss training can contribute to weight loss, because liss workouts dont burn as many calories as high-intensity workouts like hiit, it may take longer to burn the same number of calories. however, liss workouts tend to not increase appetite as much as hiit.

question: who are liss workouts best for?
answer: liss workouts are ideal for those looking to improve aerobic fitness, beginners, individuals with overweight or obesity, and those with knee or back issues. it is also a good option for those who have more time for longer workouts.

question: do i need to warm up before resistance band workouts? how?
answer: take a short, brisk walk to get blood flowing and add in a few bodyweight movements that mimic those youll be doing during your workout.

question: how many calories do resistance band workouts burn?
answer: its unclear how many calories resistance band workouts specifically burn. a 155-pound person can burn approximately 108 calories in 30 minutes of general weight lifting.

question: what muscles do you use for resistance band workouts?
answer: the muscles you target during a resistance band workout varies depending on which resistance band exercise youre performing. but you can use resistance bands to strengthen every muscle in your upper body and lower body.

question: is there anyone who shouldnt try resistance band workouts?
answer: resistance band training is generally safe. but if youre recovering from an injury, consult your doctor or physical therapist about the safest exercises to do. also, check with your doctor before starting any workout routine if youre new to exercise, elderly, or have a chronic health condition.

question: what should i wear for resistance band workouts?
answer: wear comfortable, breathable clothing that doesnt restrict your movement. you can wear athletic shoes if youd like, but bare feet may be okay if youre exercising at home.

question: do i need to warm up before a barre workout?
answer: its a good idea to warm up before any workout, including barre. do light aerobic activities like walking or jumping jacks, followed by gentle body weight exercises that mimic the movements youll be doing in barre.

question: how many calories does barre burn?
answer: how many calories you burn during barre workouts depends on various factors, including your age, weight, sex, and genetics. it also depends on the length and intensity of the workout. in general, you might burn 250 to 500 calories during a 60-minute class.

question: what muscles do you use for barre?
answer: barre is a total-body workout. it primarily targets the chest, shoulders, abdominals, glutes (buttocks), quadriceps (the muscles in the front of your thighs), hamstrings (the muscles in the back of your thighs), calves, and feet.

question: is there anyone who shouldnt try barre?
answer: because barre is low impact, its a relatively safe activity for people of all ages and abilities. however, its a good idea to talk with your doctor before beginning any new exercise, especially if youre recovering from an injury or have a chronic health condition like heart disease or diabetes.

question: do i need to warm up before a hiit workout? how?
answer: you should absolutely warm up before doing hiit. do 5 to 10 minutes of light aerobic activity like jumping jacks or walking. if your workout includes strength exercises, warm up by practicing the moves youll perform later.

question: how many calories does hiit burn?
answer: how many calories you burn during a hiit workout will depend on many factors, including your weight, age, how hard you work, which activities you do, and how long your workout is. but an intense 20 minutes of calisthenics (bodyweight exercises) burns roughly 157 to 229 calories.

question: what muscles do you use for hiit?
answer: the muscles you target during a hiit workout will vary depending on which exercises youre doing. for example, a hiit workout on a bike will use different muscles than a workout that incorporates strength-based movements.

question: is there anyone who shouldnt try hiit?
answer: because hiit is more intense than other workouts, it may not be appropriate for everyone. check with your doctor first if youre new to exercise, are recovering from injury, or have a medical condition. you should also do consistent aerobic exercise about three to five times a week for 20 to 60 minutes for several weeks before trying hiit.

question: what should i wear for a hiit workout?
answer: moisture-wicking activewear that allows you to move and bend is best. match your footwear to the activities youll be doing. if youre running, walking, or cycling, use shoes specific to those sports. if your hiit workout incorporates strength exercises, use cross-training shoes.

question: is a rowing machine a good workout?
answer: yes, a rowing machine provides an effective cardiovascular workout. it also strengthens your leg, core, arm, and back muscles without putting a lot of stress on joints.

question: can you lose fat on a rowing machine?
answer: a rowing workout may help with weight loss by causing you to burn more calories a 30-minute moderate-intensity rowing machine workout burns an estimated 252 calories for a person who weighs 155 pounds, or 369 calories if performed at a vigorous intensity. however, diet also plays a role in fat loss.

question: can you get in shape by just rowing?
answer: rowing is an excellent cardiovascular activity that also strengthens your legs, core, arms, and back. however, experts also advise incorporating strength training into your routine at least twice a week.

question: how long should you do a rowing workout?
answer: your personal goals and level of experience with exercise in general and rowing in particular will dictate how long your rowing workout should last. beginners should start with five minutes and build from there. those who are more experienced can try a 30- to 45-minute rowing session.

question: what is the tabata workout?
answer: tabata involves performing 20 seconds of all-out intensity exercise, resting for 10 seconds, then repeating for eight rounds (four minutes total).

question: what is the difference between hiit and tabata?
answer: high intensity interval training (hiit) is a category of exercise that involves alternating short bursts of high-intensity activity with rest or lower-intensity activity. tabata is an especially intense type of hiit with a specific structure.

question: is tabata good for weight loss?
answer: research suggests that hiit in general can be an effective exercise approach for weight loss. however, tabata workouts, specifically, may be too short to burn enough calories to promote weight loss.

question: why is it called tabata?
answer: tabata is named after its creator, izumi tabata, phd. dr. tabata created the workout, known as the tabata protocol, for japans olympic speedskating team in the 1990s.

question: does the tabata protocol work?
answer: the tabata protocol was studied by tabata and his colleagues in 1996. their study found that six weeks of tabata training improved aerobic and anaerobic fitness better than moderate intensity aerobic exercise.

question: what is a functional strength workout?
answer: the primary goal of a functional strength workout is to improve movement. the resistance exercises used in a functional strength workout typically recruit multiple joints and mimic the movement patterns youre trying to improve.

question: what is an example of functional strength training?
answer: squats can help improve movements such as sitting and rising from a chair. dead lifts can train you to pick up heavy objects without pulling a muscle in your back. and step-ups build strength for climbing stairs and other single-leg movements.

question: what are the five functional strength movements?
answer: you primarily use five basic movement patterns in daily life hinge (or bend-and-lift), lunge (or single-leg), push, pull, and rotate (or twist). functional strength exercises mimic these movement patterns, including deadlifts, squats, push-ups, chin-ups, step-ups, torso twists, and more.

question: how do i start functional strength training?
answer: functional strength training programs are most effective when theyre individualized to address your movement goals and abilities. a certified personal trainer can create a challenging yet doable program for you.

question: can you lose weight with functional strength training?
answer: research suggests functional strength training is an effective form of exercise for weight loss. it emphasizes movements that recruit several large muscle groups, which tend to burn more calories. functional strength training also builds muscle, which burns more calories at rest than fat.

question: can i get fit from rock climbing?
answer: rock climbing requires help from several muscle groups, making it a cardio workout with great fitness perks. research shows that it can create significant improvements in vo2 max (the maximum amount of oxygen your body can use during exercise), a common indicator of cardiovascular fitness. rock climbing also strengthens muscles and bones.

question: is rock climbing good for belly fat?
answer: theres no research to prove that rock climbing can help with belly fat. however, it may burn as many calories as running at a moderate pace (8 to 11 minutes per mile). rock climbing also builds muscle, which burns more calories at rest than fat. this can contribute to the calorie deficit you need to lose weight.

question: how do i start rock climbing?
answer: an indoor climbing gym is a great place to learn how to climb in a safe environment. often, climbing gyms allow you to simply show up and start climbing after completing a waiver and a video or person-led orientation. many climbing gyms also offer group classes for those looking for more instruction. some gyms have shoes and gear for rent, but check before you go.

question: is rock climbing a hard sport?
answer: overall rock climbing is considered a hard sport. it has a grading system used to rate the difficulty of a climb. the routes at the lower end of the scale are easier, and as you move higher on the scale, the climbing holds (where you grip the rock wall) become smaller and harder to navigate.

question: what is barre exercise?
answer: barre is a form of physical exercise, usually conducted in group classes in gyms or specialty studios. it is distinguished from other group fitness activities by its use of the ballet barre and its incorporation of movements derived from ballet. these classical dance movements and positions are combined with those drawn from yoga and pilates. barre classes typically focus on small, pulsing movements with emphasis on form, alignment and core engagement.

question: is jumping rope really a good workout?
answer: jumping rope is one of the most effective cardio workouts around, elevating your heart rate and engaging multiple muscle groups. its a full-body workout that engages arms, core, abs, chest, legs, butt, and even your heart and brain. the neuromuscular focus benefits speed, agility, quickness, and coordination.

question: how long should a good jump rope workout last?
answer: you can begin with as little as 10 minutes of jumping rope. as you build endurance, you can increase your time. most jump rope classes dont involve constant jumping with no breaks. many include rest periods as well as activities like squats, push ups, and sit ups.

question: what are the health benefits of jumping rope?
answer: incorporating a jump rope routine into your regular workouts could come with impressive benefits like strengthening your cardiovascular system, improving your coordination and balance, increasing your endurance, and helping you lose weight.

question: is jumping rope good for reducing belly fat?
answer: some jump rope exercises intentionally work the core, but no form of exercise can specifically target belly fat. still, that doesnt mean you wont see results around your middle. any exercise performed regularly can contribute to strength and toning. the key to seeing results from jumping rope (or any type of fitness) is consistency.

question: how many calories does jumping rope burn?
answer: jumping rope is definitely a calorie-torcher. depending on how vigorously or fast you jump, you can expect to burn from 400 to 1,000 calories per hour based on your body weight and the intensity or speed of the workout.

question: what is a warm-up exercise?
answer: a warm-up exercise is any movement that prepares your body for the more intense activities of a workout.

question: is stretching a good warm-up?
answer: dynamic stretching is an effective warm-up. it involves actively tightening your muscles and moving your joints through their full range of motion throughout the stretch. static stretches, which involve holding a stretch for up to 45 seconds, should be saved for post-workout.

question: what are three common warm-up exercises?
answer: light aerobic activity such as walking, dynamic stretches such as hip circles and leg swings, and light resistance movements such as bodyweight squats and banded side-steps are a few common types of warm-up exercise.

question: what is the best way to warm-up before exercise?
answer: the exact warm-up varies depending on the workout. a good format to follow is a few minutes of light aerobic exercise, followed by dynamic stretches and light resistance exercises that focus on the muscles youll target in your workout.

question: how long should a warm-up be?
answer: in general, a warm-up must last 5 to 15 minutes in order to increase blood flow, heart rate, flexibility, and mobility.

question: what is low-impact exercise?
answer: low-impact exercise is any activity where at least one foot is always in contact with the ground. this lowers the impact forces placed on the joints, making low-impact exercise a great option for people with joint issues.

question: what is the difference between low-impact and high-impact workouts?
answer: whereas low-impact exercises (such as walking, elliptical training, and cycling) involve keeping at least one foot on the ground, high-impact exercises (some are running and jump training) call for both feet to leave the ground. when both feet leave the ground, the forces from gravity and your body increase the impact on your joints when you land.

question: what are five examples of low-impact exercise?
answer: great low-impact exercises include walking, cycling, elliptical training, resistance training, and yoga. swimming also qualifies as a low-impact exercise, because the water absorbs the impact from gravity.

question: can i lose weight with low-impact exercise?
answer: any form of exercise will burn calories, which may help you lose weight if you reach a caloric deficit. research suggests that resistance training combined with caloric restriction is an effective weight loss approach.

question: are low-impact workouts more effective?
answer: both low- and high-impact workouts can boost fitness, build muscle, improve mood and brain health, strengthen bones, and aid weight loss. low-impact workouts may be more effective for people with joint issues, as they offer the opportunity to exercise with less joint discomfort and pain.

question: what are the health benefits of running?
answer: running (like other types of aerobic exercise) can boost your mood, energy levels, memory, and focus, and improve your cardiovascular health, respiratory function, and bone density.

question: is running every day healthy?
answer: consistent running is important for building endurance, but if you are just starting out, its better to err on the side of caution and not run too much or too hard too quickly. with time, you can safely start to increase speed, distance, and frequency of runs.

question: whats the difference between running and walking?
answer: running is the action of rapidly propelling yourself forward on foot. when running, there is a moment when both feet are off the ground (as opposed to walking, when one foot is always on the ground), making it a high-impact exercise.

question: do runners live longer?
answer: research suggests yes, runners may have as much as a 25 to 40 percent reduced risk of premature death compared to non runners. (but remember thats looking at death rates among a large group of runners and non runners how long any one individual lives depends on myriad factors.

question: what should i wear when i run?
answer: experts suggest dressing in layers in cold weather and choosing moisture-wicking clothes in all conditions because they draw the sweat away from the body, decreasing your chances of your body getting chilled during your run.

question: what is strength training?
answer: strength training, also known as resistance training, is a type of exercise that causes your muscles to resist an external force. you can apply force using your body weight, dumbbells, kettlebells, barbells, resistance bands, exercise machines, or several other tools.

question: how many days a week should i strength train?
answer: the number of days that is ideal to strength train per week depends on your goals, fitness level, and schedule. at a minimum, physical activity guidelines recommend adults should strength train the major muscle group (chest, back, legs, shoulders, back, biceps, and core) twice per week.

question: what are the different types of strength training workouts?
answer: common strength workouts include power lifting, olympic weight lifting, bodybuilding, crossfit, and functional strength training.

question: what are the benefits of strength training?
answer: research supports many benefits of strength training, including greater muscle strength and size, stronger bones, improved mood, and a longer lifespan.

question: is strength training good for weight loss?
answer: research shows that strength training may aid weight loss when combined with calorie restriction. it may not burn as many calories as aerobic exercise, but adding muscle helps improve body composition over time.

question: why is flexibility important?
answer: flexibility, the amount of stretch a muscle allows, is important because it lets our muscles move through their full range of motion. it helps prevent strain or stress on other parts of the body and allows us to perform everyday tasks and exercises safely.

question: how does limited flexibility affect mobility?
answer: when muscles are too tight, mobility becomes limited. this can make it difficult to perform everyday tasks and exercises, increasing the risk of muscle strains and tears.

question: what are the different types of stretches to improve flexibility?
answer: the different types of stretches to improve flexibility include static stretching (holding a stretch), dynamic stretching (stretches that gently move joints through their full range of motion), myofascial release (foam rolling), active isolated stretching (stretches are held for two seconds), and proprioceptive neuromuscular facilitation (a partner applies force and then the exerciser works either the stretched muscle or its opposing muscle).

question: how does strength training improve flexibility?
answer: strength training can improve flexibility by improving overall muscle function and mobility. it can also improve flexibility in certain areas of the body, especially when exercises that focus on lengthening the muscle are performed.

question: what can cause problems with mobility besides inflexibility?
answer: other factors besides inflexibility, such as arthritis, injuries, muscle imbalances, and weakness, can cause problems with mobility. it's important to receive an evaluation from a qualified professional to determine the underlying cause and find the best solution.

question: is running up stairs a good workout?
answer: yes, there are numerous health benefits to stair climbing, including strengthening your heart and lungs and burning calories.

question: is stair climbing cardio?
answer: yes, stair climbing is a cardiovascular workout. the movement necessary to vertically ascend stairs increases your heart and breathing rate, making stair climbing good for your cardiorespiratory system.

question: how many stairs should i climb for a good workout?
answer: how long, how quickly, and how many flights of stairs youll need to climb to get a moderate or intense workout depends on your current fitness level. a good beginner stair workout could start with five minutes of stairs, gradually building up time or intensity as your fitness improves.

question: is climbing stairs good for losing weight?
answer: a change in eating patterns (such as a decrease in calories) is a main driver of weight loss, but exercise supports these efforts by increasing the calories youre burning over the course of a day. stair climbing burns approximately 432 calories per hour. (because of the intensity, its unlikely youll stair climb for a full hour.)

question: is climbing stairs as good as walking?
answer: stair climbing is different from walking. ascending stairs is typically more intense than walking on flat ground, as you have to propel your body vertically against gravity. both forms of exercise can fit into a weekly program.

question: is boxing a good workout?
answer: boxing is a high intensity workout that builds fitness, strength, and coordination. it's also a great calorie-burner approximately 324 in 30 minutes.

question: what type of exercise is boxing?
answer: boxing is primarily a cardio exercise, but it also strengthens the muscles in the core and lower body.

question: what muscles does boxing work?
answer: when done correctly, boxing works the entire body. but it mainly targets the muscles in the core and lower body.

question: whats the best way to start boxing at home?
answer: begin by attending classes at a boxing studio so you can learn the proper technique. then, follow at-home workout videos or live and on-demand classes led by certified instructors. find options on youtube, a fitness app, or boxing studio websites.

question: is boxing good for weight loss?
answer: boxing burns a good amount of calories and can be an effective workout for weight loss. the exact number of calories depends on the length and intensity of the boxing workout, as well as the movements involved. your weight loss results will also depend on your genetics, experience level, and diet.

question: what is pickleball?
answer: pickleball is a beginner-friendly court sport played with paddles and a perforated plastic ball. for most, its quicker to pick up than other racket-based sports (like tennis or badminton), and it is growing in popularity in the united states.

question: what is body muscle imbalance?
answer: the muscles on each side of your body should be symmetrical with each other in size and strength. when a muscle (or muscles) on one side of your body is larger, smaller, stronger, or weaker than the corresponding muscle(s) on the other side, you have a muscle imbalance.

question: what equipment do i need for pickleball?
answer: one reason pickleball is such an accessible game is that there is not much equipment needed to play it. each player on the court needs a paddle, and youll need a pickleball as well. its fine to bring your own paddle and ball, but depending on where youre playing, that equipment may be provided to you.

question: is pickleball a workout?
answer: pickleball is considered an aerobic activity, and studies show that playing it can help improve cardiovascular fitness. that said, pickleball can be played in a slower, more casual way, too, or you can crank up the intensity and incorporate more running and movement into the game.

question: can pickleball help with weight loss?
answer: pickleball is considered a moderate intensity aerobic activity. while it certainly burns calories, you will also likely need to decrease the calories in your diet in order to lose weight.

question: what is the best way to start exercising?
answer: start with mini bursts of movement, such as standing up from your desk and walking around your home/office, walking up your stairs, or taking your dog around the block.

question: do i need a personal trainer?
answer: if you are new to exercise or you dont know how to safely perform exercises or structure a workout plan, a personal trainer can help. hitting a fitness plateau, not knowing how to train harder, and not knowing how to train safely with a health problem or condition are also all good reasons to seek out a personal trainer.

question: is working out 30 minutes a day long enough?
answer: guidelines from the u.s. department of health and human services recommend that adults get at least 150 minutes of moderate intensity physical activity and two days of full-body muscle-strengthening activities per week. that can be accomplished in 30 minutes a day, though more activity may yield more health benefits.

question: how do i know if im working out hard enough or if i need to increase the intensity of my workout?
answer: experts like to use the talk test to determine whether you are maintaining enough effort for it to count as moderate-intensity exercise. you should be moving hard enough that you can talk  but not sing. with vigorous-intensity exercise, you might find yourself breathless and have difficulty talking.

question: is dancing a good workout?
answer: yes, if youre dancing vigorously enough to raise your heart rate and hasten your breathing, youre getting moderate-intensity exercise, which boosts cardiovascular and overall fitness. because dance engages multiple muscle groups, it usually counts as a full-body workout.

question: are dance workouts good for beginners?
answer: though some styles of dance and some dance workouts are more advanced, most studios (or apps and other virtual platforms) offer a variety of beginner classes. if youre looking for a workout you can stick with, dance may be a great option because it's fun (especially if you pick a style and music you enjoy).

question: what muscles does dancing work?
answer: the muscles you'll work will depend on the style of dance and the specific choreography or movements youre doing. in general, many styles of dance work the hamstrings, quads, glutes, and calves.

question: how many calories does dancing burn?
answer: how many calories you burn dancing depends on the physical intensity of the dance and how long you do it for. thirty minutes of dancing burns an estimated 90 to 252 calories, depending on the dance style and your body weight.

question: whats the best way to warm up for a dance workout?
answer: some classes and dance workouts start with a warm-up, so you dont need to warm up ahead of time. if not, aim to do some light cardio to bring your heart rate up and perform a few dynamic stretches to fire up your muscles. try hip rolls, body rolls, chest isolations, and light jumps.

question: what is somatic movement?
answer: one way to describe somatic movement is motion during which you focus on the internal experience and feeling of the movement instead of what it looks like from the outside. you have to be present and aware of what is happening in the moment during the movement. somatic stretching is one type of somatic movement.

question: how is somatic stretching different from regular stretching?
answer: normal stretching typically means moving or holding various parts of your body to extend the muscles. somatic stretching focuses on releasing tension in the body through natural, unintentional movements.

question: what are the benefits of somatic movements?
answer: people who regularly practice somatic movements might see improvements in posture, flexibility, range of motion, and balance. somatic stretching can also strengthen your mind-body connection, which can help you better manage overall health.

question: how often should you do somatic exercises?
answer: its safe to practice somatic stretching daily if youre doing the technique correctly. when practicing somatic stretching, it is important to listen to your body and your personal limits, so as not to physically push any movement too far or in a way thats uncomfortable.

question: whats an example of a somatic stretch?
answer: one of the most straightforward somatic stretches is standing awareness. stand up straight with your feet rooted into the ground. now, just notice how your feet are in contact with the floor, notice how your stomach moves slightly as you breathe in and out, and scan your body for any tension.

question: is cycling a good workout?
answer: cycling can help improve cardiovascular health and build strength, especially in your lower body.

question: does cycling have other health benefits?
answer: cycling, like most exercises, can benefit your physical and mental health. studies show that cycling can improve sleep quality, cardiovascular health, brain health, and your mood.

question: can cycling help with weight loss?
answer: any aerobic exercise can help with weight loss, and research has found that regular cycling can help people lose weight. if youre trying to lose weight remember, however, that dietary choices are important, too.

question: can i cycle every day?
answer: cycling can be your only form of exercise, but instructors advise people, especially beginners, to ride every other day or a couple times a week. giving yourself rest days between rides will allow you to train at a higher level when you do ride with less risk of injury.

question: whats the best cycling workout to get started with?
answer: the best way to start cycling workouts is by doing short 20 to 30 minute rides. in time, you can increase the speed, duration, and frequency of your rides. to make cycling a more challenging workout, experts suggest cross-training with other exercise methods, introducing low-level intervals, and riding more often.

question: why is swimming good for me?
